column2: The Role The Failure Analysis Engineer will be a core member of the Quality team. In this visible and critical role, you will work closely with Design, Engineering, NPD and Executive Leadership to bring your knowledge to high quality products.   Job Description Identify root-cause of failing devices (from the field or during development) across several disciplines including manufacturing/ electrical/ mechanical/ material issues. Effectively work with cross-functional teams (Manufacturing/ Product Engineering/ Operations/ Quality) to understand root cause and drive corrective actions. Write clear and complete failure analysis reports with actionable messages digestible to multiple audiences. Transfer data to information, and information to a decision. Work with CMs/JDMs to develop and standardize failure analysis procedures for new and existing products. Act as the person-on-ground for FA programs on behalf of the US FA engineers- this may include roaming trips to JDM locations where necessary. Improve time to root cause and time to corrective actions. Improve FA effectiveness. Minimum Qualifications 5-7 years of failure analysis experience. Masters degree or greater in mechanical engineering, electrical engineering, material science or physics, or equivalent practical experience. Hands-on experience in advanced material analysis using different techniques. Experience in a technical/engineering role in failure analysis, materials engineering/testing, electrical engineering, product development or equivalent. Considerable hands-on experience in 2 of the following: CAD, mechanical testing, Analog/Digital Circuit Design, Devices/Sensors, Embedded Systems, Optical Design, RF Engineering, Microfabrication, MEMS, Computed Tomography X-Ray. Functional knowledge of mechanical, electrical, electronic, and optical components. Working knowledge of statistics, production control processes, data analysis and interpretation. Excellent written and oral communication skills. Ability to effectively communicate with US and Asia teams. Project management. Accountability. Strategic thinking. Experience with consumer products (smartwatch/smartphone, etc.) Hands-on experience in failure analysis of modular components (displays, speakers, batteries, buttons, etc.) and good understanding of electronic assembly processes. Experience with FA tools such as SEM, EDS, CT, cross section, red dye, X-Ray, CSAM, thermal camera. 30% travel.    Preferred Qualifications Influencing others: leading teams to improve time to root cause and corrective actions. Self-starter and creative problem-solver. Experience with ODM, JDM, or CM models of failure analysis.

column2: Qualification Bachelors in electrical engineering Reports to Principal Electrical Engineer  South Pacific Purpose of the position - Ensure that all electrical systems provide adequate functionality at required reliability with minimum cost of ownership in compliance with internal and external regulations. - Support the implementation of a strategy for sourcing, engineering, maintaining and troubleshooting electrical systems in a standardised way. ?- Support the continuous improvement of assets, work processes and people capabilities to maximize business profitability optimizing functionality, reliability, efficiency and lifecycle cost of electrical systems. Geographical Area of responsibility Australia & New Zealand but located in Vadodara, Gujarat Functional area of activity Operation, engineering, installation, maintenance and troubleshooting of electrical systems including: ?- Power system analysis including fault, load flow, arc flash, protection co-ordination, motor start-up etc. using Etap (Version 20.0 and over)- High/Medium/Low voltage substations and switchgears, ?- HV & LV Motors, - Motor starters including VSD, start/delta, liquid resistance starter, soft starter etc. - Transformers, - Generators, - Battery & UPS system, ?- Lightning protection and earthing, - Electrical equipment in hazardous area (EEHA) AU/NZS familiarity. ?- Online and offline electrical testing, RESPONSIBILITIES Leadership -?Support RSP technical lead on various improvement objectives. Operations - Provide Electrical Systems technical support to the operating sites. Maintenance Provide technical advice to local maintenance teams for the sourcing, replacement and troubleshooting of electrical systems. This includes: ?- Standardisation of equipment and service providers, - Review of online and offline maintenance plans, - Review of online condition monitoring test results, - Assess the competence of maintenance personnel for electrical systems and ensure that gaps between the actual and the required competence are closed. ?- Ensure that maintenance for electrical systems is adequate, cost efficient and in compliance to Linde work processes Projects / Modifications Modifications: - Design and/or review all major modifications to electrical systems. - Ensure update of the related plant documents in document management system after modification, ?- Lead implementation of initiatives resulting from safety alerts, Provide input to: - scope definition, costing & schedule - specification of respective equipment & services - selection of vendors & service suppliers - subcontract construction & installation activities ?- testing & commissioning for major modifications of the existing electrical systems (including emergency situations). For electrical systems of new plants or process units: - ensure relevant requirements are defined and reviewed by members of the team - ensure electrical system structures & vendors are compliant with Linde standards and specific project/site requirements - participate in relevant project reviews and acceptance (incl. factory and site acceptance tests, handover of systems) - ensure maintenance teams are trained to operate, maintain and troubleshoot the new systems ?- ensure all necessary documents are handed over, are of good quality and are stored in the Linde Gas Global Document Management system. Troubleshooting - Provide remote support to RSP electrical engineers where requested. Reporting / performance management - Review downtime reporting of electrical system failures at sites - Review internal and external maintenance cost - Review open actions for sites and provide direct support for site teams to close actions. ?- Report implementation status of initiatives resulting from alerts, Lessons from Reliability Events and directives KEY INTERFACES External interfaces - Suppliers - Selection of suitable regional suppliers, agree on technical scope/solution, stage  gate inspection to ensure quality. - Service Providers (for maintenance & engineering) - Selection of suitable regional providers, agree on scope, ensure quality. ?- Plant Suppliers - Define requirements, review proposed design, participate in stage gate reviews and plant acceptance. Internal interfaces - communicate directives, alerts & initiatives. Support maintenance, trouble-shooting etc - Projects & Improvements - develop design concepts, review EMOCs and provide expert input to improvement projects - eg, support scope definition, system design and design reviews. - Opportunity & Project Development - define technical requirements specific to local site. Participate in stage gate reviews, Lead handover and acceptance of electrical systems ?- Procurement - Work with Procurement to ensure that all supply agreements are properly implemented when required. REQUIRED SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS Key soft skills - Ability to take right decision based on facts under pressure - Establish and maintain collaborative authority with contractors/suppliers - Ability to influence/convince cross functional teams including superiors - Strong problem solving and project management skills. - Good negotiation skills ?- Good oral & written communication skills in English language to explain and document reasoning for decisions. Key functional skills - Experience in performing various power system studies using Etap (Version 20.0 or over). - Experience in operating, maintaining, troubleshooting HV and LV electrical systems. - Experience with electrical isolation and re-energisation. - Detailed technical knowledge of relevant electrical equipment and systems. - Background in electrical safety with knowledge of hazards involved in operation and maintenance of electrical systems. - Detailed knowledge with relevant national and international codes and standards. - Experience in root cause failure analysis - Strong capability to facilitate or lead risk assessments and make risk based decisions - Experience in designing and building electrical systems. ?- Experience in design of lightning protection and earthing. - Experience in hazardous area inspection, design, maintenance. - Experience in performing power system studies (fault level, load flow, arc flash, protection coordination) using Etap model. - Read and understand electrical schematics. - Experience with cable sizing and earth loop impedance calculations.

column2: Purpose of the Role This role is to undertake the electrical and controls design for Materials Handling Systems from concept through to final installation and As Built status. They will also be required to manage the procurement of all electrical goods on projects, assist with MCP sub-contracts and provide technical help to the Project Management team during the installation portion of the project. They should understand PLC and SCADA systems and provide assistance to the software team. Controls Design  Produce Field Device Layouts and Emergency Stop layouts.  Produce Electrical Schematics in accordance with Contract specifications and Local standards.  Produce Motor Control Panel Layout drawings.  Review Functional safety requirements. Undertake electrical design calculations. Establish Variable Frequency Drive (VFD) parameter sets. Write Tender Documents (MCP Build and Installation) Produce test and commissioning documentation. Compile Operation and Maintenance Manuals Controls Project Management -  Review Project and Contract documentation and sales pricing to establish areas of risk. Raise and close out Requests For Information where specification ambiguities occur. Assist in Motor Control Panel manufacture tenders and sub-contract builds to ensure quality, budgets and timelines are met. Assist the Project Managers in the electrical installation tender process, issuing technical, specifications and drawings and answering technical questions. Assist the Project Managers during the installation and commissioning phases of all projects (may require overseas travel) Understand and implement good document control processes on all projects. Candidate Profile   BE Electrical . Member of Institution of Engineers (India) MIE CEng (India). Member of Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE)  A working knowledge of some or all the following are required -  AutoCAD  E-Plan  MS Word  MS Excel  MS Access  Visual Basic  MS Project  PLC Programming packages (Rockwell, Siemens and Omron preferred)  SCADA packages  Must have Material Handling and preferably from Baggage Handling background Fluent in English, especially on technical matters. Demonstrate Electrical and Controls Design Experience.  A good understanding of Variable Frequency Drives and motor control  Demonstrate clear understanding of technical specifications.  Capable of reading, understanding, and developing electrical circuits  A working knowledge and understanding of the requirements of SP 30 or equivalent international wiring standards and regulations.  Personal skills, competencies & knowledge kept up to date & identifying own & other staff training needs.  Ability to work with commercially sensitive & confidential information excising the highest degree of discretion.

column2: The Senior Estimation/Proposal Engineer is responsible for analyzing project requirements, preparing detailed cost estimates, and creating comprehensive proposals for potential clients     This role involves collaborating with various departments to gather necessary information, utilizing estimation software and tools, and ensuring that proposals are accurate, competitive, and aligned with the organization's goals     Key Responsibilities:Project Analysis:Review project plans, specifications, and requirements to understand project scope     Conduct site visits, if necessary, to assess project conditions and requirements     Cost Estimation:Prepare accurate and detailed cost estimates for labor, materials, equipment, and overhead     Utilize estimation software and historical data to enhance the accuracy of estimates     Identify and quantify cost factors, such as production time, materials, and labor expenses     Proposal Development:Develop comprehensive proposals outlining project scope, objectives, methodology, and timelines     Prepare detailed technical and commercial proposals that address client needs and specifications     Work closely with technical teams to ensure that the proposed solutions are feasible and meet the client's requirements     Bid Preparation:Prepare and submit bids to clients within specified deadlines     Collaborate with procurement and vendor management teams to gather supplier/subcontractor quotes and integrate them into the proposals     Competitive Analysis:Conduct market research and competitive analysis to determine pricing strategies     Evaluate competitor proposals and pricing to ensure competitiveness and differentiation     Client Interaction:Communicate with clients to understand their needs and address queries related to the proposal     Participate in client meetings and presentations to explain the proposal details and address concerns     Documentation and Reporting:Maintain detailed records of estimates, proposals, and relevant documentation     Generate reports on estimation and proposal activities, highlighting successes, challenges, and areas for improvement     Continuous Improvement:Stay updated with industry trends, best practices, and new technologies related to estimation and proposal engineering     Contribute to process improvements and the development of standardized estimation methodologies within the organization     Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Construction Management, or a related field     Several years of experience in estimation and proposal engineering, preferably in the relevant industry     Proficiency in estimation software and tools     Strong analytical and mathematical skills     Excellent communication and presentation abilities     Project management skills and attention to detail     Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment     Strong negotiation skills and business acumen     A Senior Estimation/Proposal Engineer plays a crucial role in securing new projects and ensuring that the organization's proposals are competitive, accurate, and aligned with client expectations
column11: Switchgear, PLC, Electricals

column2: As a PLC (Programmable Logic Controller) Automation Engineer, your role would involve designing, developing, implementing, and maintaining automation systems using PLCs     PLCs are digital computers used for controlling industrial processes and machinery     Here are some key responsibilities and activities typically associated with this position:System Design and Development: Designing and developing control system architectures and PLC programs based on project requirements     Collaborating with cross-functional teams, including mechanical engineers, electrical engineers, and software developers, to integrate PLC systems with machinery and equipment     PLC Programming: Writing and debugging PLC programs using programming languages such as ladder logic, structured text, or function block diagrams     Configuring PLC hardware, I/O modules, and communication protocols     Implementing logic and control algorithms to automate industrial processes     HMI (Human-Machine Interface) Development: Designing and developing user-friendly HMI screens and interfaces for operator interaction with the PLC systems     Creating visualization screens, alarms, and data logging functionalities     Ensuring effective communication and data exchange between the HMI and PLC     System Integration and Commissioning: Integrating PLC systems with other components, such as sensors, actuators, motor drives, and SCADA (Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition) systems     Testing, calibrating, and commissioning the automation systems to ensure proper functionality and performance     Troubleshooting and Maintenance: Analyzing and diagnosing problems in PLC systems, identifying faults, and implementing corrective actions     Conducting preventive maintenance activities, including regular backups, firmware upgrades, and system optimizations     Resolving issues related to PLC hardware, software, and communication interfaces     Safety and Compliance: Ensuring compliance with safety standards and regulations in the design and implementation of PLC systems     Implementing safety measures, such as emergency stop circuits, interlocks, and fault detection mechanisms     Conducting risk assessments and addressing safety concerns in the automation process
column11: Automation, Electrical Engineer, PLC, Consultancy, Electricals, SCADA

column2: As an MEP Engineer at Nambiar Builders Pvt Ltd, you will be responsible for the design, coordination, and implementation of mechanical, electrical, and plumbing systems in construction projects. Your role involves ensuring that these systems meet technical requirements, comply with regulations, and contribute to the overall functionality and sustainability of buildings. Key Responsibilities: System Design:  Design mechanical, electrical, and plumbing systems for buildings, including HVAC (heating, ventilation, and air conditioning), electrical distribution, lighting, fire protection, plumbing, and drainage systems. Ensure designs meet project specifications, codes, and industry standards. Coordination:  Coordinate MEP designs with architects, structural engineers, and other stakeholders to ensure integration with building layouts and structural elements. Address any conflicts or design issues that arise during the planning and construction phases. Technical Analysis:  Conduct technical analysis and calculations to determine system requirements, load capacities, energy efficiency, and other performance parameters. Use software tools and modeling techniques to optimize system designs and identify cost-effective solutions. Material and Equipment Selection:  Select appropriate materials, equipment, and components for MEP systems based on project requirements, performance criteria, and budget constraints. Evaluate vendors and suppliers to ensure quality and reliability of products. Regulatory Compliance:  Ensure that MEP designs and installations comply with building codes, regulations, and industry standards, such as ASHRAE, NFPA, NEC, and local plumbing codes. Obtain necessary permits and approvals from regulatory authorities. Quality Assurance:  Oversee the installation, testing, and commissioning of MEP systems to ensure they function as intended and meet design specifications. Conduct site inspections and quality audits to identify and resolve any installation issues or deficiencies. Project Management:  Manage MEP aspects of construction projects, including scheduling, budgeting, and resource allocation. Coordinate with contractors, subcontractors, and vendors to ensure timely completion of MEP work within project deadlines. Sustainability and Energy Efficiency:  Integrate sustainable design principles and energy-efficient technologies into MEP systems to minimize environmental impact and reduce operating costs. Recommend strategies for improving energy performance and optimizing system efficiency. Qualifications and Skills: Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or related field. Professional engineering license (PE) or equivalent certification preferred. Previous experience in MEP design, construction, or consulting engineering role. Proficiency in CAD software (AutoCAD, Revit) and MEP design software. Strong understanding of building codes, regulations, and industry standards related to MEP systems. Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills. Effective communication and interpersonal skills for collaborating with multidisciplinary teams and clients. Project management skills, including the ability to prioritize tasks, manage deadlines, and coordinate resources effectively. As an MEP Engineer, you play a vital role in the design, coordination, and implementation of mechanical, electrical, and plumbing systems in construction projects. Your expertise ensures that buildings are equipped with efficient, safe, and sustainable MEP systems that meet technical requirements and regulatory standards. By integrating innovative technologies and best practices, you contribute to the success and longevity of infrastructure developments while optimizing energy usage and environmental performance. Kindly mail your CV to hr@nambiarbuilders.com

column2: Short Description for Internal Candidates :  BE/BTech in Electrical or Electronics Engg with 12~15 years of experience in testing, certification, and Lab operation. May participate in corporate or regional initiatives to address and resolve laboratory quality, technical consistency, and testing accuracy issues. Manager in Electrical Maintenance is a professional responsible for overseeing and managing the electrical maintenance activities within an organization. The role involves ensuring the smooth operation and reliability of electrical systems, equipment, and machinery.   General: To secure that all works and task of the section are carried out according to in force company rules and department processes  To secure that all his employees have the right education, training and certificates in order to allow them to fulfil their job responsibilities To follow up department objectives, elaborate action plans and determine the necessary resources in order to fulfil them Provides Maintenance Manager with established reports and charts to track maintenance key indicators To secure that all works and task of the section are carried out according to safety rules The employee has to carry out all other ad hoc tasks defined by his superior Implement new projects as applicable. 2. Preventive maintenance: In cooperation with his superior and subordinates establish preventive and predictive maintenance programs on machinery as per Rockbis PM Module ensuring unscheduled repairs are minimized, Planning of the Electrical department activities Coordination with other departments  Production, Purchase, Stores, HR,PQE, Accounts Analyzes preventive works, unscheduled maintenance works and failure analysis data to improve equipment performance and reliability 3. column1: Standard Cell Layout Design engineer role
column2: This role is for a motivated Standard Cell Layout Design Engineer with 3-5 years of experience to contribute to the development of high-performance integrated circuits (ICs) by designing and creating efficient standard cell layouts. You will play a critical role in ensuring the functionality, performance, and manufacturability of these essential building blocks for complex chip designs. Responsibilities: Design and develop standard cell layouts for various logic functions (e.io gates, flip-flops, memories) adhering to defined design rules and company layout methodologies. Perform parasitic extraction and carry out layout optimizations for power, performance, and area (PPA) using Electronic Design Automation (EDA) tools. Collaborate with circuit design engineers to understand their requirements and translate them into manufacturable and optimized standard cell layouts. Ensure layout adherence to physical design rules (PDRs) and company layout styles using Computer Aided Design (CAD) tools. Participate in layout verification using Layout Versus Schematic (LVS) tools to ensure layout accurately reflects the circuit schematic. Generate physical verification data according to industry standards (e.g., Open Alliance Design File - OASIS) for chip integration. Contribute to the development and maintenance of the standard cell library within the organization. Stay up-to-date with advancements in standard cell design methodologies and EDA tools. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or a related field. 3-5 years of experience in standard cell layout design for integrated circuits. Proficiency in Electronic Design Automation (EDA) tools for layout design and verification (e.g., Cadence Virtuoso, Calibre, Solido). Strong understanding of physical design concepts, layout rules, and design for manufacturability (DFM) principles. Working knowledge of circuit design fundamentals and digital logic concepts. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to identify and resolve layout issues. Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment and meet deadlines. Strong communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with design teams. Preferred Skills: Experience with scripting languages (e.g., Python, TCL) for automating layout tasks (a plus). Experience with advanced layout optimization techniques (clock tree synthesis, power planning) (a plus). Experience with emerging technologies for future chip design nodes (e.g., FinFET) (a plus). Familiarity with low-power design techniques for standard cell layouts (a plus).
column11: EDA Tools, Standard cell layout design, Layout Design, Verification, future chip design nodes, Clock Tree Synthesis, power planning

Troubleshoot and repair VFD and servo systems to ensure optimal performance and minimal downtime. Collaborate with engineering teams to integrate drive and servo solutions into projects. Provide technical support and guidance to internal teams regarding VFD and servo systems. Stay updated on industry advancements and best practices in electrical and drive technology. Should have good knowledge of Siemens make VFD and Servos such as G120, G130 , S120, Simotion D, etc. Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Electrical / Instrumentation / Electronic Engineering or a related field. Proven experience working with VFDs and servo systems in industrial settings. Strong understanding of electrical principles and drive control theory. Proficiency in troubleshooting and repairing electrical and drive systems. Detail-oriented with strong problem-solving abilities. Experience with PLCs and automation systems is a plus. Maintains safe work habits and actions in all aspects of the daily task; evaluates reactive work for safety issues, plans projects so that safety is key, and reviews preventative work for any unforeseen items that may present safety hurdles. Learns to diagnoses malfunctioning systems, apparatuses, and components using test equipment and hand tools to locate the cause of breakdown and correct the problem. Utilizes software to track, assign, and prioritize reactive, planned, preventative and predictive maintenance work, and building management system. Performs work cross-functionally to make repairs within ones capability. Performs work in a wide variety of conditions, such as extreme heat, cold, moisture, and confined space. Attends classes and on/off site training programs (travel if required) and makes appropriate progress necessary to build basic skills and knowledge required to pass local certification. Participates in improvement projects; uses common problem solving techniques while working alone or in teams. Qualifications - External Skills Communicates effectively - Developing and delivering multi-mode communications that convey a clear understanding of the unique needs of different audiences. Action oriented - Taking on new opportunities and tough challenges with a sense of urgency, high energy, and enthusiasm. Customer focus - Building strong customer relationships and delivering customer-centric solutions. Collaborates - Building partnerships and working collaboratively with others to meet shared objectives. Decision quality - Making good and timely decisions that keep the organization moving forward. Self-development - Actively seeking new ways to grow and be challenged using both formal and informal development channels. Facilities Maintenance - Assesses the condition of the facility including its systems, structure, interiors, exteriors and grounds; manages facility operations and maintenance activities; develops and operates asset management systems for Preventative Maintenance's that uses criticality analysis, predictive tools and prioritization. Emergency Preparedness - Plans, manages and supports the site?? emergency preparedness program; identifies risks and develops a risk management plan to address incidents such as power outage, flood, and fire; manages the maintenance of emergency systems for fire and flood protection; reports any system impairments. Facility Electrical Technical - Troubleshoots, repairs, and installs Electrical distribution systems, buss bars, breaker boxes, motors and other electrical equipment to enable the facility to operate properly with lights and electricity provided to the production activities. Facility Heating Ventilation and Air Conditioning Technical - Troubleshoots, repairs, and installs heating equipment, boilers, ventilations systems, chillers, cooling tower, air compressors and other mechanical equipment, in order to provide heating or cooling as needed to the facility, people and processes of producing products as needed. Education, Licenses, Certifications High school diploma or certificate of completion of secondary education or equivalent experience to the extent such experience meets applicable regulations. Must meet the minimum educational requirements to start the apprenticeship or regional program. Must pass all related testing. ? Experience Requires some work experience or intermediate level knowledge obtained through education, training or on-the-job experience. ? Education Qualification :High School Diploma in Electrical Branch Experience : 6-8 Yrs in Electrical Maintenance?

column2: Position overview  We are looking for Site Commissioning Engineers with 1-5 years of experience in commissioning projects at various sites in India. The Site Commissioning Engineers will be responsible for ensuring the successful implementation and integration of control systems, SCADA systems, and drives at client sites. Preferred location - MUMBAI  Position overview  Conduct site surveys and assessments to gather information for project planning and execution.  Develop commissioning plans, schedules, and procedures in coordination with project managers and engineering teams. column2: Looking to take the next step in your career? Hatch is currently seeking a highly motivated? SPEL Electrical Engineer? to join our Project Delivery Group (PDG) in? Gurgaon/ Gurugram  India. PDG helps clients reach their business goals through a range of strong technical capabilities. We ensure world-class project delivery through the skills of our people, methodologies, governance, and systems. Our engineering and project management and construction disciplines ensure safe, efficient, and sustainable delivery of projects globally across the metals and mining, infrastructure, and energy sectors.? The SPEL Electrical Engineer will be part of an engineering team providing engineering services to large and small projects.? The Electrical Engineer is responsible for preparing engineering calculations, technical specifications, data sheets and reports. The Electrical Engineer is also responsible for assistance/participation in on-site commissioning. The Electrical Engineer reports to the Lead Electrical Engineer on a large project and to the Project Manager or Engineering Manager on small projects, i.e. functions as the Lead Electrical Engineer on small projects.?? Key Responsibilities Prepare, subject to the approval of the Lead Electrical Engineer, technical documentation required for the execution of the project, including but not limited to design criteria, design calculations, system studies, , technical / standard specifications, SLDs, grounding/ lightning/lighting design, lists& schedules, data sheets, package engineering, as-built documentation, detail drawings etc Strong experience in SPEL database to produce Electrical Deliverables - Standard Schematics, Cable Schedules, SLDs  MCCs & DBs, Load Lists, Termination schedules, MTO etc. Provide input to intra /inter discipline on timely basis to meet discipline / project objectives Review vendor /shop drawings to ensure conformity with engineering designs. Manage and coordinate with the Lead/Senior Electrical Engineers the progress of the engineering work in accordance with the project scope, schedule and procedures. Assist the Lead Electrical Engineer with the delivery of project requirements as they relate to scope, cost and schedule. Assist the Lead Electrical Engineer to measure, on a monthly basis, the progress of the engineering work packages to ensure that project budgets and schedules are being met. Assist the Lead Electrical Engineer in implementing corrective action as required. Assist the Lead/Senior Electrical Engineers in reviewing the outcome of quality audits of engineering work and perform remedial work in accordance with the project procedures and the quality assurance plan. Assist the Lead/Senior Electrical Engineers in ensuring that the checking of documentation and interdisciplinary coordination is implemented in accordance with project procedures.   You bring to the role -  Good knowledge in General Electrical Engineering and in all standard Equipment sizing      calculations Good knowledge of system studies (preferably in ETAP)  SPEL experience will be  added advantage  Package Engineering experience will be added advantage Engineering and Design experience on major capital projects  Minimum 5 yrs full time experience post Engineering in Electrical (5 to 12 yrs experience      preferred) Good knowledge of IEC / IEEE, ANSI requirements and major Electrical codes/ standards

column2: We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Electronics Engineer with 8-10 years of expertise in Analog, Mixed Signal, board power, high-speed design, and analog front end technologies. As a key member of our engineering team, you will play a crucial role in the development of cutting-edge electronic systems, ensuring their functionality, performance, and reliability.       Responsibilities:                                   Analog and Mixed Signal Design:                                   Lead the design and development of analog and mixed-signal circuits, ensuring high performance and reliability in various applications.                                       Board Power Design:                                   Design, analyze, and optimize board power distribution systems to meet project requirements, considering efficiency, thermal management, and power integrity.                                       High-Speed Design:                                   Spearhead high-speed digital and mixed-signal PCB layout and routing, ensuring signal integrity, impedance matching, and compliance with industry standards.                                       Analog Front End (AFE) Development:                                   Architect and implement analog front ends for various sensor interfaces, ensuring accurate signal conditioning and robust performance in challenging environments.                                       Collaboration:                                   Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including hardware, software, and firmware engineers, to integrate analog components seamlessly into overall system architecture.                                       Documentation:                                   Generate detailed design documentation, including schematics, layout guidelines, test plans, and reports, to facilitate efficient collaboration and knowledge transfer within the team.                                       Risk Assessment and Troubleshooting:                                   Identify potential risks in the design process and implement mitigation strategies. Actively participate in troubleshooting and root cause analysis activities.                                       Continuous Learning:                                   Stay abreast of the latest industry trends, technologies, and tools related to analog and mixed-signal electronics. Provide mentorship and knowledge sharing within the team.                                     Qualifications:                                 Bachelor s or Master s degree in Electrical Engineering or a related field.                                 8-10 years of hands-on experience in Analog, Mixed Signal, board power, high-speed design, and analog front end development.                                 Proficient in using design tools such as SPICE simulation, Schematic Capture and PCB tools                                 Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.                                 Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.                                 Proven track record of successful project delivery and product development.

column2: The Role: Senior Engineer Service Support - UV Manager Commercial Operation is responsible for providing sales support for the complete project cycle and act as an integrator to align internal efforts with external requirements to maximize win possibilities. He should be able to manage all the process like deal qualification, techno-commercial proposal finalization, costing in co-ordination with procurement team, and deal reviews, due diligence, contract /purchase order preparation & reviews, preparation of risk register, price benchmarking with market intelligence, competitors intelligence, dashboards, maintaining database etc. He should be good team player and have the ability to align strategy with company?? resource alignment. The role requires effective coordination with the sales leaders, Proposal Engineering, Sourcing, Projects, Manufacturing, finance team. The role also requires coordination with leadership team for various deal reviews which includes discussions on strategy, price, risks involved. Essential Duties/Principal Responsibilities: Able to Read SLD, GA drawings Able to read and understand Control and schematic drawings, Cable schedule etc. Knowledge in Basic of Electrical Basic knowledge to understand Mechanical and civil drawings. Basic knowledge about water treatment plants.   Hands on experience on Troubleshooting of Electrical and electronics circuits, Equipments and components like Motor, power supply, Breakers, MCCB, contactors, Starter unit, Relays, Surge suppressor unit, Harmonic filters, PCB Boards, HMI, PLC, Plug in connectors, Hands on experience in cabling, glanding, termination. Knowledge about ESH and Electrical safety Knowledge about basic testing and testing instruments handling for service purpose. Hands on experience in Handling of Measuring instruments. Hands on experience in handling of Hand Tools and Power tools. Working knowledge in Computer, Communication with PLC and PCB boards. Knowledge about MSDS . Minimum Qualifications: Education, Experience, Skills, Abilities, License/Certification: Education - Min.Diploma or BE/B Tech in Electrical, Electrical and Electronics. Experience - 5-7 Years Education- electrical engineer Additional Responsibilities: Develop commercial acumen and deal closure mindset Perform / coordinate for customer, distributor and agent due diligence Keep a track of trends and development in Indian Pump industry Actively participate in team meetings, dept meetings Additional Information: Physical Demands Travelling as and when required. Willing to work after office hours, week offs etc. whenever required. Work Environment Office: Standard office equipment; work usually performed in an office setting free from any disagreeable elements. Standard weekly job hours: 40 Hours

column2: As an Engineer - Electrical Component, you will be responsible to execute electrical engineering projects for complex power generation and moto-compression trains, Acting as a unique entry point for the Customer, starting from the bidding phase up to the train commissioning and start-up, taking the lead during the overall project phases.        As an Electrical Systems Engineer, you will be responsible for:        Performing a technical selection of all electrical items in the scope of supply (e.g., Electrical MV generators, Electrical MV motor, MV Variable Speed Drive Systems, DCP/MCC, Batteries etc.)      Formulating functional purchase specifications and close technical alignment of supplier technical proposals      Managing technical documentation during the engineering development phase following up with suppliers and customer up to finalization.      Carrying out engineering design reviews with suppliers and customers to ensure compliance with customer contractual specifications and project-applicable international rules      Participating in FAT (Factory Acceptance Tests) for main/critical items and supporting to manufacturing team for internal testing. Engineering site support during plant commissioning and start-up      Executing electric studies and simulations and electro-mechanic studies with the use of simulation tools like MATLAB/Simulink, ETAP and DigSilent.            Fuel your passion          To be successful in this role you will:        Have a BE/BTech OR ME/MTech OR Full-time Diploma in Electrical/ Electronic Engineering Or similar with proven expertise in Electrical disciplines in Oil and Gas Equipment      Have proven engineering experience of a minimum of 4 years within an engineering environment.      Have substantial technical knowledge of electrical item design and selection, e.g., rotating machines, MV/LV panels, and variable speed drive systems.      Have demonstrated experience in working with cross-functional teams within a global-matrix environment      Have experience in problem-solving, with an analytical approach to identifying root causes and implementing solutions      Have fluency in English. Have working knowledge of MATLAB or Simulink, Dig SILENT / ETAP simulation tools are preferred.      Have the ability to influence others & to coordinate several projects simultaneously.      Have fluency in English and good oral and written communication skills.      Have good interpersonal and leadership skills.
column11: Plant commissioning, Bidding, Simulation, Analytical, Engineering Design, Simulink, MCC, MATLAB, Operations, Technical documentation

column1: Engineer Project Associate - Wind Turbine, Electrical
column2: Working under the supervision of the global team and support the renewable energy certification projects globally. He/she will evaluate design calculations for approval of electrical components, control and protection systems and prototype test results mainly focusing on wind turbines. Additionally, he/she will inspect customer factories to witness the correct implementation of specific electrical component designs and factory acceptance tests. Electrical and control system related design evaluation and interpretation of test results for conformity according to international standards will be the main aspects of the job.  Further, the engineer will be responsible for administration requirements relating to certification, independent execution and timely completion of projects by analyzing project scope and determining project specifications, coordinating with clients during the course of the project.  JOB RESPONSIBILITIES: Working closely with the Segment leader and Global team, the Engineer will be responsible for Project execution, Customer management and expanding UL Renewables Certification services in India.  Key responsibilities are, Electrical and Control & Protection System evaluation according to international standards like IEC 61400-1. Evaluation of Electrical and Control system related prototype test results according to IEC 61400-22 or other relevant standards. These test results includes, power curve measurements, power quality measurements, safety and function tests evaluation, etc. Evaluation of grid connection requirements test results for compliance with various national grid codes (for example India, Germany, etc.) Electrical network analysis with commercialized modelling and simulation tools (for example DIgSILENT Power Factory, Mathworks MATLAB/Simulink and SimPowerSystems or similar) Inspection of manufacturers facilities to witness electrical components tests and manufacturing evaluation. Communication with business partners in India and abroad HIRE-IN Masters/Bachelors degree in Electrical/ Power System/ Control System Engineering, or any equivalent field Minimum 2-7 years of relevant experience in the field of power system analysis or renewable energy industry Experience in commercialized modelling and simulation tools (for example DIgSILENT Power Factory, Mathworks MATLAB/Simulink and SimPowerSystems or similar) is desirable Hands-on experience on electrical components testing and inspection, international grid connection requirements, are desirable Willingness to travel (within India and outside the country) Excellent organizational and time management skills Good communication skills (English speaking and writing) Customer focus, commitment and independent work Strong technical aptitude and ability to work in a fast paced consultancy environment Ability and willingness to develop and expand business Experience in the continuous development of work processes (Lean Six Sigma) is desirable
column11: Wind Turbine, IEC 61400-1, Electrical

column2: Bachelors degree in Electronics Engineering or a related field.     A minimum of 4 years of experience in Electronics Manufacturing, Process Engineering, or a related role.     Profound knowledge of electronic components, assemblies, and manufacturing processes.     Strong problem-solving skills and a data-driven approach to process optimization.       Your Task     You will play a vital role in connecting Business Development and Plant Operations, shaping the success of our Medical Devices and Healthcare products. With your in-depth understanding of Mechanical Engineering, manufacturing processes, and mechanical design, you will lead the way in enabling procurement and localization activities during new product inquiries and the initiation of new programs.       Collaborate closely with Business Development and Plant Operations teams to ensure seamless communication and alignment of manufacturing processes with project goals.     Apply your extensive knowledge of Electrical Engineering, manufacturing processes, and electrical design to create and optimize manufacturing methods for medical devices and healthcare solutions.     Evaluate current manufacturing processes, identifying opportunities for enhancement in terms of efficiency, quality, and cost-effectiveness.     Lead the development and implementation of innovative manufacturing techniques to enhance productivity and product quality.     Troubleshoot and resolve manufacturing issues related to mechanical components, assemblies, and systems.     Establish strong relationships with suppliers to ensure a consistent supply of high-quality materials for manufacturing.     Collaborate with cross-functional teams to successfully introduce new processes and drive continuous improvement initiatives.     Maintain comprehensive documentation, including work instructions, process flows, and quality standards.     Stay informed about industry trends, technological advancements, and best practices to drive innovation in manufacturing processes.     Work closely with RD, product management, and design teams to support the development of new medical devices from concept to market launch.
column11: Procurement, Product management, Supply chain, Medical devices, Electrical design, Manufacturing process, Healthcare, Product design, Automotive, Logistics

column2: About us:   We are focused on the One Health approach to promote Human, Animal and Environmental health. We provide an open, interactive and non-hierarchical work environment and believe in work pleasure rather than work pressure?? Job brief:   As a Service Technician you will be carrying out preventive and corrective maintenance as well as developing, installing, and testing electronic systems & equipment. YOu will work closely with the MicroGO team of engineers and scientists in performing troubleshooting, ensuring accurate records for customers, and providing excellent customer service. In this role, you will: Assemble the device as per the instruction given by the team with 0% failure. Conduct routine visits & Install equipment following Standard Operating Procedures. Maintain existing customer equipment in working conditions. Train customers on safe equipment use, cleaning procedures, and product information. Diagnose and resolve technical problems and/or conditions. Desired candidate:  Diploma/ ITI in EEE/ECE /Electrical and electronics 1+ years of field service experience (maintaining industrial equipment / mechanical/Electronics/ Electrical problem solving)  Basic electrical and electronics knowledge Soldering knowledge Knowledge on assembly of electronic device  Understanding of industrial SOP Good communication skills Preferred candidate profile   Male Candidates are preferred

column2: Position overview  We are looking for Site Commissioning Engineers with 1-5 years of experience in commissioning projects at various sites in India. The ideal candidates will have a strong background in Siemens, Rockwell, ABB, or Mitsubishi PLC programming, SCADA development, and drives. The Site Commissioning Engineers will be responsible for ensuring the successful implementation and integration of control systems, SCADA systems, and drives at client sites. Preferred location - MUMBAI  Position overview  Conduct site surveys and assessments to gather information for project planning and execution.  Develop commissioning plans, schedules, and procedures in coordination with project managers and engineering teams. Install, configure, and program PLCs, SCADA systems, and drives from Siemens, Rockwell, ABB, Mitsubishi, or other manufacturers.  Perform system integration and testing to ensure proper functionality and performance of control systems.  Troubleshoot and debug control systems, PLC programs, and SCADA applications to identify and resolve issues. Qualification 1-5 years of experience working as a Site Commissioning Engineer in the field of industrial automation.  Strong knowledge of PLC programming, SCADA development, and drives from Siemens, Rockwell, ABB, Mitsubishi, or similar manufacturers.

column2: Role & responsibilities   Key Responsibilities:   *  Project Planning and Design: Collaborate with design teams to review electrical plans and specifications for solar projects. Conduct site surveys to assess electrical infrastructure and determine optimal placement of solar panels, inverters, and other electrical components.  *  Installation and commissioning: Supervise electrical installation activities on-site, including the mounting of solar panels, wiring, and connection of inverters. Conduct inspections to ensure compliance with electrical codes, safety standards, and project specifications. Oversee the commissioning process to ensure that solar systems are fully operational and performing efficiently. *  Troubleshooting and Maintenance: Diagnose and resolve electrical issues that may arise during installation or operation. Develop maintenance plans and schedules to ensure the long-term performance and reliability of solar systems. Conduct periodic inspections and testing to identify potential problems and implement corrective measures.  *  Documentation and Reporting: Maintain accurate records of electrical work performed, including installation reports, test results, and as-built drawings. column2: As an MEP Engineer at Nambiar Builders Pvt Ltd, you will be responsible for the design, coordination, and implementation of mechanical, electrical, and plumbing systems in construction projects. Your role involves ensuring that these systems meet technical requirements, comply with regulations, and contribute to the overall functionality and sustainability of buildings. Key Responsibilities: System Design:  Design mechanical, electrical, and plumbing systems for buildings, including HVAC (heating, ventilation, and air conditioning), electrical distribution, lighting, fire protection, plumbing, and drainage systems. Ensure designs meet project specifications, codes, and industry standards. Coordination:  Coordinate MEP designs with architects, structural engineers, and other stakeholders to ensure integration with building layouts and structural elements. Address any conflicts or design issues that arise during the planning and construction phases. Technical Analysis:  Conduct technical analysis and calculations to determine system requirements, load capacities, energy efficiency, and other performance parameters. Use software tools and modeling techniques to optimize system designs and identify cost-effective solutions. Material and Equipment Selection:  Select appropriate materials, equipment, and components for MEP systems based on project requirements, performance criteria, and budget constraints. Evaluate vendors and suppliers to ensure quality and reliability of products. Regulatory Compliance:  Ensure that MEP designs and installations comply with building codes, regulations, and industry standards, such as ASHRAE, NFPA, NEC, and local plumbing codes. Obtain necessary permits and approvals from regulatory authorities. Quality Assurance:  Oversee the installation, testing, and commissioning of MEP systems to ensure they function as intended and meet design specifications. Conduct site inspections and quality audits to identify and resolve any installation issues or deficiencies. Project Management:  Manage MEP aspects of construction projects, including scheduling, budgeting, and resource allocation. Coordinate with contractors, subcontractors, and vendors to ensure timely completion of MEP work within project deadlines. Sustainability and Energy Efficiency:  Integrate sustainable design principles and energy-efficient technologies into MEP systems to minimize environmental impact and reduce operating costs. Recommend strategies for improving energy performance and optimizing system efficiency. Qualifications and Skills: Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or related field. Professional engineering license (PE) or equivalent certification preferred. Previous experience in MEP design, construction, or consulting engineering role. Proficiency in CAD software (AutoCAD, Revit) and MEP design software. Strong understanding of building codes, regulations, and industry standards related to MEP systems. Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills. Effective communication and interpersonal skills for collaborating with multidisciplinary teams and clients. Project management skills, including the ability to prioritize tasks, manage deadlines, and coordinate resources effectively. As an MEP Engineer, you play a vital role in the design, coordination, and implementation of mechanical, electrical, and plumbing systems in construction projects. Your expertise ensures that buildings are equipped with efficient, safe, and sustainable MEP systems that meet technical requirements and regulatory standards. By integrating innovative technologies and best practices, you contribute to the success and longevity of infrastructure developments while optimizing energy usage and environmental performance. Kindly mail your CV to hr@nambiarbuilders.com

column2: Envirotech Services  is looking for Shift Engineer ( Electrical )  to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey     A Shift Engineer, also known as a Shift Technician or Maintenance Engineer, is responsible for overseeing the operations and maintenance of equipment, systems, and facilities during a specific shift     Their role involves monitoring, troubleshooting, and maintaining the smooth functioning of machinery and infrastructure     Here are some key responsibilities of a Shift Engineer:Equipment Monitoring and Maintenance: Shift Engineers continuously monitor the performance of equipment, machinery, and systems within their assigned area     They conduct regular inspections, perform preventive maintenance tasks, and address any issues or malfunctions that may arise     This includes repairing or replacing faulty components, conducting routine lubrication and calibration, and ensuring equipment is operating within specified parameters     Troubleshooting and Repair: When equipment malfunctions or breaks down, Shift Engineers are responsible for diagnosing and troubleshooting the problem     They use their technical expertise and problem-solving skills to identify the root cause of issues and implement effective solutions     This may involve repairing or replacing faulty parts, adjusting settings, or coordinating with external contractors for more complex repairs     Safety and Compliance: Shift Engineers ensure compliance with safety protocols and regulations     They conduct regular safety inspections, identify and address potential hazards, and take corrective actions to mitigate risks     They also follow standard operating procedures and adhere to relevant regulations and guidelines     Emergency Response: In the event of an emergency or equipment failure, Shift Engineers are responsible for taking immediate action to resolve the issue     They assess the situation, implement emergency procedures, and coordinate with other team members or external resources to minimize downtime and ensure the safety of personnel and equipment     Record Keeping and Documentation: Shift Engineers maintain accurate records of maintenance activities, equipment performance, repairs, and other relevant information     They document work orders, log maintenance activities, update equipment manuals, and create reports on equipment downtime, maintenance costs, and productivity metrics

Your Task     You will play a vital role in connecting Business Development and Plant Operations, shaping the success of our Medical Devices and Healthcare products. Evaluate current manufacturing processes, identifying opportunities for enhancement in terms of efficiency, quality, and cost-effectiveness.     Lead the development and implementation of innovative manufacturing techniques to enhance productivity and product quality.     Troubleshoot and resolve manufacturing issues related to mechanical components, assemblies, and systems.     Establish strong relationships with suppliers to ensure a consistent supply of high-quality materials for manufacturing.     Collaborate with cross-functional teams to successfully introduce new processes and drive continuous improvement initiatives.     Maintain comprehensive documentation, including work instructions, process flows, and quality standards.     Stay informed about industry trends, technological advancements, and best practices to drive innovation in manufacturing processes.     Work closely with RD, product management, and design teams to support the development of new medical devices from concept to market launch.

column2: 6+ years of technical engineering experience     OR Bachelors degree in Electrical Engineering or related field AND 2+ years of technical engineering experience     OR Masters degree in Electrical Engineering or related field AND 1+ year(s) of technical engineering experience.           Background Check Requirements:          Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings:        Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.       While not required, we also look for the following Preferred Qualifications:       Bachelors degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related field AND 5+ years of technical engineering experience     OR Masters degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related field AND 3+ years of technical engineering experience.                       Design       Develop basic knowledge of industry trends, competitors products, customer experience, and advances in various engineering fields. Consult with other engineers to help understand and apply advanced concepts.     Assist in the creation and execution of robust, scalable, secure, and extensible designs and/or verification plans for the electrical engineering aspects of a well-defined feature or product extension (eg, a product refresh, or line extension).     Participate in creating intellectual property. May file patents within personal area of scope and complete necessary patent documentation.     Implement known solutions to common technical and/or design challenges, with some guidance from other engineers.     Read device specification sheets and interpret common details required to design and test various hardware features.      Develop design documentation which could include drawings, specifications, schematics, or diagrams for features of well-defined products with guidance and direction from a manager or other engineers.     Review supplier or partner technical sheets for available parts and choose appropriate parts needed to support product development.       Testing and Verification       Ensure that test requirements are included in documentation and specifications for a feature or product.     Determine the appropriate test equipment (eg, oscilloscopes, spectrum analyzers, logic analyzers) for measuring a feature of a product according to existing verification plans, with minimal supervision from other engineers.     Write design verification test cases using standard templates and test methodologies.      Develop, review, and execute test plans and/or infrastructure for standard features or products.     Assist in developing automated testing solutions and independently conduct automated testing on standard feature areas or products.     Gather data for external testing supplier or partner selection options.     Assist in setting up and breaking down testing environments with guidance and supervision from other engineers. Follow safety guidelines.     Participate in the development of dashboards or reports for testing and quality metrics that can be utilized to characterize hardware and hardware performance.     Analyze and interpret results of data and statistical analyses to identify common problems or flaws that may affect a feature or product design change and bring them to the attention of other engineers or team leads.     Assist in the development of basic test fixtures for use in testing or validation of new product features under guidance from other engineers.       Technical Project Implementation       Follow project implementation schedules to deliver the hardware engineering aspects of a well-defined feature or product. Escalate issues to management as necessary.     Implement and track product plans, under guidance from other engineers.     Highlight potential issues that may affect downstream execution of projects (eg, performance vs. reliability and manufacturing concerns).      Research new tools, technologies, or processes for project implementation and provide reports to project team members.     Assist in implementing risk assessments (eg, supplier or partner delays, incomplete specs, or tool issues) into project plans.     Communicate project progress/status within the project team and escalate issues as necessary.       Reporting and Documentation       Follow established procedures to participate in creating detailed reports and functional specifications for a well-defined product feature or extension, based on audits and information from product development and verification processes.     Document essential details about materials, components, and/or assemblies for a device via accepted release processes. Accurately record and track changes to designs following established processes with some guidance from other engineers.       Other       Embody the Microsoft One culture and values.

column2: Junior Officer [Electrical] Balmer Lawrie is a Mini Ratna I Public Sector Undertaking under the Ministry of Petroleum & Natural Gas. The Company operates in various business segments through Strategic Business Units [SBUs] and Joint Venture Companies [JVCs]. You can visit the Company's website http://www.balmerlawrie.com/ for further details about the Company.  - The company is looking for qualified and experienced professionals to man the role of Junior Officer [Electrical] for the Company. It is in the Grade of  O1  in the  Pay Scale  of  Rs.   21750  65000 .     The Position Profile is as follows :     Maximum Age  : 25 years as on 05.07.2024 Minimum Post Qualification Experience (Years)  : 1 Year as on 05.07.2024     Minimum Qualification :  Diploma [Undergraduate  Engineering] - Electrical*** with Electrical Supervisor License or Competency Certificate [Successful candidates will be offered only if they are able to produce relevant certificate with regard to Mandatory Qualification as above] Preferred Qualification :  Those with PLC Certification may be preferred Preferred Experience:  3 years in hands-on maintenance in light engineering industry, candidate to satisfy himself/herself about suitability with given job requirements and preferences. Experience in PLC may be preferred Indicative Job Description :       The incumbent shall be responsible for: 1. Managing, supervising, carrying out entire maintenance activities in a manufacturing plant with particular focus on electrical and allied maintenance requirements, including addressing PLC and related issues expeditiously 2. Hands-on plant maintenance/ shift operations to achieve manufacturing, machine/ equipment/ electrical utility availability and related targets incl. ensuring maintenance of up to 11 KVA HT lines 3. Carrying out all necessary maintenance and inspection activities in relatively independent fashion as may be required for ensuring achievement of daily / weekly/ monthly production and machine/ equipment/ utility availability targets, including but not limited to: a. Ensuring attendance and focused application of engineering, maintenance, electrical and other competencies for the entire duration of work in flexible shifts, daily/ weekly schedules or otherwise, to fulfil the manufacturing/maintenance targets, exercising discipline in matters of attendance and leave ensuring these do not interfere with achievement of work targets  b. Ensuring daily/ hands-on/ preventive/ break-down maintenance, arranging daily cleaning, lubrication, tightening, testing, sampling, trials, inspection, data collection, reporting, data entry in system etc.  to be carried out before/after normal production hours or on weekly-off day or without interfering with normal production time  c. Keeping fully updated of manufacturing and maintenance requirements, plans, schedules, sales plans, specific customer requirements, material and product specifications, machine and maintenance manuals, maintenance related service provider details, consumable and other vendor/ contract details, scheduled electricity outages and maintenance schedules etc. and aligning work efforts accordingly, proactively seeking complete information and support from seniors and all other departments as may be required for same  d. Arranging, bringing, taking delivery of/ shifting materials, WIPs, removing waste materials etc. using hands-on or driving sophisticated material handling equipment viz. fork-lifts, pallet trucks, cranes etc., before/ after normal production hours or during idle time or without interfering with normal production time, as required for maintenance and related tasks  e. Arranging for consumables, services, support, contractor staff, utilities, equipment and all inputs to maintenance before/ after normal production hours or during idle time or without interfering with normal production time and in accordance with production / maintenance schedule or plan, change-over requirement etc.  f. Real-time support to all manufacturing related technical issues, understanding the issues, analyzing, identifying and deploying solutions in mechanical/electrical/ electronic maintenance/ trouble shooting domain, hands-on support and training to production resources in all such technical aspects  g. Troubleshooting in Siemens PLC/ Coordination with experts for such as required  h. Ensuring assigned maintenance task is never left unfinished and satisfying that the task is providing the expected result in terms of trouble free machine performance or output, never allowing input, process or output to be other than as per required pa r a meters, never allowing productivity to fall below established/required stands  4. Achieving physical and budgetary parameters in area of manufacturing/maintenance including yields, machine availability, rejection, cost/ wastage reduction etc.  5. Liaison with Electricity supply and other authorities for job requirement, compliances 6. Effective utilization of services of contractors or their manpower through concerned contractors' supervisors etc. Vendor development and support to developing tender specifications and related Purchase processes as required, particularly in maintenance an d related domain  7. Maintaining timely data, generating required MIS, preparing maintenance schedules, improvement projects, capex plans, budget pro visions etc. as required 8. Participation in Operational Excellence activities 9. Implementing 5 S in assigned area 10. Complete compliance with Employee Health Safety Policy; ensure proper use of Personal Protective Equipment  11. Support to shift based production operations including carrying out responsibilities of hands-on shift in-charge as required from time to time  12. Actively seek, obtain and learn from Company Manuals, Process documents, SOPs, HSE guidelines, Policies, MSDSs, Performance and review processes, Conduct and Discipline rules, peer/ internal/ external training opportunities, work related Acts and rules, and from colleagues, to obtain all guidance, training and inputs for successful completion of all job responsibilities  13. Understand clearly and utilize/ comply with available policies, health, safety, welfare, progression, feedback and other engagement facilities and forums for ensuring proper management of work stresses and professionally resolving any work-related issues The above responsibilities mentioned are indicative and not exhaustive. column2: The Estimation Engineer is responsible for analyzing project requirements, preparing cost estimates, and providing accurate and competitive bids for construction or engineering projects.    They will work closely with project managers, engineers, and procurement teams to gather necessary information and develop comprehensive cost estimates.    The Estimation Engineer plays a crucial role in ensuring the accuracy and profitability of project bids.          Key Responsibilities:           Review project plans, specifications, and contract documents to understand project requirements and scope.      Collaborate with project managers, engineers, and other stakeholders to gather necessary information for cost estimation.      Analyze project drawings, technical specifications, and bills of quantities to determine the quantities and costs of materials, labor, and equipment required.      Conduct site visits and assessments to gather information and assess project conditions that may impact cost estimates.      Prepare accurate cost estimates, including material take-offs, labor costs, equipment costs, and indirect costs.      Research and source material and equipment prices from suppliers and subcontractors to ensure accurate pricing in estimates.      Evaluate project risks and contingencies and incorporate them into cost estimates.      Prepare detailed cost breakdowns, including cost summaries, itemized lists, and supporting documentation.      Participate in bid review meetings to present cost estimates, answer questions, and provide clarifications to stakeholders.      Collaborate with procurement teams to assist in sourcing and evaluating suppliers and subcontractors for cost competitiveness.              Qualifications and Skills:           Bachelor's degree in engineering, construction management, or a related field.        Strong knowledge of construction methods, materials, and processes.      Proficiency in reading and interpreting project drawings, specifications, and contract documents.      Experience with cost estimation software and tools.      Strong analytical and mathematical skills, with attention to detail.      Excellent organizational and time management skills to handle multiple projects and meet deadlines.      Good communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate effectively with project teams and stakeholders.      Knowledge of local construction codes, regulations, and industry standards.      Ability to work independently and make sound decisions based on project requirements and constraints.

column2: We are seeking an experienced Electrical Maintenance Engineer to join our team in the Oil and Gas sector     The ideal candidate will be responsible for ensuring the safe and efficient operation of electrical systems and equipment within our facilities     This role requires strong technical expertise in electrical maintenance, troubleshooting, and repair, along with a deep understanding of safety protocols in a hazardous environment           Key Responsibilities:         Conduct regular inspections and assessments of electrical systems, equipment, and components in accordance with industry standards and safety regulations.     Perform preventive maintenance tasks on electrical systems to minimize downtime and ensure their optimal functioning.     Diagnose electrical faults, malfunctions, and breakdowns, and take corrective actions promptly to restore operations.     Coordinate with cross-functional teams to plan and execute maintenance activities, including shutdowns and turnarounds.     Collaborate with instrumentation and control teams to ensure integrated system functionality and troubleshoot any interrelated issues.     Maintain accurate records of maintenance activities, including equipment history, repairs, and replacements.     Develop and implement maintenance strategies that align with industry best practices and the companys operational objectives.     Participate in root cause analysis for electrical failures and provide recommendations to prevent recurrence.     Stay updated with industry trends, technological advancements, and regulatory changes related to electrical systems in the oil and gas sector.     Ensure compliance with safety guidelines, procedures, and protocols to mitigate risks associated with working in hazardous environments.     Provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior electrical technicians as needed.     Collaborate with procurement to source and manage spare parts inventory for electrical systems.     Support commissioning and decommissioning of electrical equipment as required.         Qualifications and Skills:         Bachelors degree in Electrical Engineering or a related field.     Professional Engineering license/certification is a plus.     Proven experience (X+ years) as an Electrical Maintenance Engineer in the oil and gas industry.     Strong knowledge of electrical systems, equipment, and components used in oil and gas facilities.     Familiarity with relevant codes, standards, and regulations, such as NEC, IEC, API, etc     Proficiency in reading electrical schematics, blueprints, and technical manuals.     Hands-on experience with testing and diagnostic equipment for electrical systems.     Demonstrated ability to troubleshoot complex electrical issues and implement effective solutions.     Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.     Strong communication and interpersonal skills for effective collaboration within cross-functional teams.     Prior experience in hazardous area classifications and safety practices.     Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.     Willingness to work in varying shifts, including weekends and on-call rotations.     Knowledge of computerized maintenance management systems (CMMS) is an advantage.     Commitment to maintaining a safe working environment and adhering to safety protocols
column11: Procurement, Spare parts, Diagnostics, Instrumentation, Troubleshooting, NEC, Operations, Preventive maintenance, Electricals, Maintenance management

column2: As a PLC (Programmable Logic Controller) Automation Engineer, your role would involve designing, developing, implementing, and maintaining automation systems using PLCs     PLCs are digital computers used for controlling industrial processes and machinery     Here are some key responsibilities and activities typically associated with this position:System Design and Development: Designing and developing control system architectures and PLC programs based on project requirements     Collaborating with cross-functional teams, including mechanical engineers, electrical engineers, and software developers, to integrate PLC systems with machinery and equipment     PLC Programming: Writing and debugging PLC programs using programming languages such as ladder logic, structured text, or function block diagrams     Configuring PLC hardware, I/O modules, and communication protocols     Implementing logic and control algorithms to automate industrial processes     HMI (Human-Machine Interface) Development: Designing and developing user-friendly HMI screens and interfaces for operator interaction with the PLC systems     Creating visualization screens, alarms, and data logging functionalities     Ensuring effective communication and data exchange between the HMI and PLC     System Integration and Commissioning: Integrating PLC systems with other components, such as sensors, actuators, motor drives, and SCADA (Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition) systems     Testing, calibrating, and commissioning the automation systems to ensure proper functionality and performance     Troubleshooting and Maintenance: Analyzing and diagnosing problems in PLC systems, identifying faults, and implementing corrective actions     Conducting preventive maintenance activities, including regular backups, firmware upgrades, and system optimizations     Resolving issues related to PLC hardware, software, and communication interfaces     Safety and Compliance: Ensuring compliance with safety standards and regulations in the design and implementation of PLC systems     Implementing safety measures, such as emergency stop circuits, interlocks, and fault detection mechanisms     Conducting risk assessments and addressing safety concerns in the automation process
column11: Automation, Electrical Engineer, PLC, Consultancy, Electricals, SCADA
