column2: Job Title: Electrical Engineer Key Objectives and Responsibilities:    The Electrical Engineer will be responsible for developing technical specifications, data sheets, cable lists, and single-line drawings. They will also be responsible for cable sizing and lighting calculation, as well as power system analysis with ETAP. Experience in the Oil Gas, Refinery, and Petrochemical industry sectors is preferred.   Responsibilities:      Prepare technical specifications of electrical equipment     Prepare cable size calculation and cable list (schedules)     Prepare load lists     Prepare single-line diagrams with designer support (only 2D drawings)     Prepare hazardous area classification with designer support (only 2D drawings)     Prepare panel schedules (power and lighting)     Prepare interconnection and wiring diagrams     Prepare control schematics     Prepare MTO/BOM     Lighting calculations     Typical installation details (cable-tray trench, grounding, lighting and power layouts)     Cable tray and trench sizing calculations     Electrical equipment sizing (transformers, switchgears, generators, bus ducts, UPS, capacitors)     Requisition for inquiry and purchase of electrical equipment (transformers, switchgears, generators, bus ducts, UPS, capacitors, cathodic protection) and bulk materials (cables, trays, lighting and grounding materials)     Technical bid evaluation of offers for electrical equipment and bulk materials TB tabulation preparation     Vendor documents review of electrical equipment and bulk materials     Desirable Skills:      Degree in Electrical Engineering or related field     Minimum of 7 years of relevant engineering experience in the Oil Gas, Refinery, and Petrochemical industry sectors     Good knowledge of international codes and standards like IEC, IEEE, NEC, NFPA, NACE, ASME, ANSI, IP, API, ASTM, ISO, Shell DEP     Software skills in ETAP (load flow, short circuit, relay co-ordination, motors starting grounding calculations) and lighting calculation Dialux (4.13, EVO)     Experience with AutoCAD, Microstation, and SP3D is an added advantage (not mandatory)

column2: As an Engineer - Electrical Component, you will be responsible to execute electrical engineering projects for complex power generation and moto-compression trains, Acting as a unique entry point for the Customer, starting from the bidding phase up to the train commissioning and start-up, taking the lead during the overall project phases.        As an Electrical Systems Engineer, you will be responsible for:        Performing a technical selection of all electrical items in the scope of supply (e.g., Electrical MV generators, Electrical MV motor, MV Variable Speed Drive Systems, DCP/MCC, Batteries etc.)      Formulating functional purchase specifications and close technical alignment of supplier technical proposals      Managing technical documentation during the engineering development phase following up with suppliers and customer up to finalization.      Carrying out engineering design reviews with suppliers and customers to ensure compliance with customer contractual specifications and project-applicable international rules      Participating in FAT (Factory Acceptance Tests) for main/critical items and supporting to manufacturing team for internal testing. Engineering site support during plant commissioning and start-up      Executing electric studies and simulations and electro-mechanic studies with the use of simulation tools like MATLAB/Simulink, ETAP and DigSilent.            Fuel your passion          To be successful in this role you will:        Have a BE/BTech OR ME/MTech OR Full-time Diploma in Electrical/ Electronic Engineering Or similar with proven expertise in Electrical disciplines in Oil and Gas Equipment      Have proven engineering experience of a minimum of 4 years within an engineering environment.      Have substantial technical knowledge of electrical item design and selection, e.g., rotating machines, MV/LV panels, and variable speed drive systems.      Have demonstrated experience in working with cross-functional teams within a global-matrix environment      Have experience in problem-solving, with an analytical approach to identifying root causes and implementing solutions      Have fluency in English. Have working knowledge of MATLAB or Simulink, Dig SILENT / ETAP simulation tools are preferred.      Have the ability to influence others & to coordinate several projects simultaneously.      Have fluency in English and good oral and written communication skills.      Have good interpersonal and leadership skills.

The Energy Division focuses on power generating facilities which offer a wide range of design and project execution experiences. Designs include the electrical interconnect to the bulk power grid and all associated power generating facility auxiliary power equipment. Equipment includes rotating machines, such as generators and motors, large power transformers, generator circuit breakers, isolated phase bus duct, non-segregated phase bus duct, switchgear, motor control centers, small power transformers, and variable frequency drives. The wide range of projects  provide  opportunities  on  both multi-discipline and electrical only projects.     Multi-disciplined power generation projects require  designers  to work in a diverse project team environment and  exhibit  the ability to develop consensus in  identifying  the  optimum  solution to complex problems. These complex assignments require the application of advanced techniques, resulting in the development of new or improved processes, equipment and/or technological methods. Position will require extensive interface with equipment suppliers/vendors, and with Burns & McDonnell project managers, other engineering disciplines, modelers, designers, and detailers locally in the Mumbai office as well as remotely in various offices in the United States. ?   The Electrical  Designer will work on an integrated design team within our Energy Global Practice to perform the following duties:         Assist  in   development of 3D model and 2D  drawing  of various electrical systems for industrial facilities including but not limited to  s ingle  l ine  d iagram of  power systems,  electrical equipment layout, hazardous area classification drawing,  interconnection & hook-up drawing,   lighting,  grounding  and  lightning protection systems . ?   Assist  and learn to c oordinate with other disciplines   and other stake holder(s) to develop a clash free system design. ?   Assist  more experienced  designers and  engineers in preparing,  coordinating  and reviewing deliverables for the discipline. ?   Displaying active learning attitude while getting t raining  from senior  staff members on various tools and discipline practices. ?   A committed team player able to work on  own  initiative.?     Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.     Good Communication skills (verbal & written) and ability to self-check and produce? accurate  work. ?        -       Diploma in Electrical Engineering  awarded in  the current or previous calendar year .? ? ? ?   Knowledge of basic technical theory and engineering principles within electrical discipline.?       Knows how to apply engineering principles for basic design analyses within discipline     Has some technical understanding of  input requirements to perform various discipline  CAD  tasks.     Has? some  understanding of  activities  carried  by other disciplines and  inter discipline coordination involved on typical project.     Basic software experience  utilizing  Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Power Point), Adobe Acrobat PDF.?     Excellent written & verbal communications as well as strong analytical &? problem solving  skills are  required . ?

column2: Role & responsibilities   Electricians are skilled professionals responsible for installing, wiring, and maintaining various electrical systems in residential, commercial, and industrial settings. They work with a wide range of electrical equipment and must have a thorough understanding of electrical codes and safety regulations. Key Responsibilities: 1. Install, repair, and maintain electrical systems according to blueprints, specifications, and industry standards. 2. Inspect electrical components such as transformers, circuit breakers, switches, outlets, lighting fixtures etc., to identify issues or malfunctions. 3. Diagnose electrical problems using testing devices such as ohmmeters, voltmeters etc., to locate the source of the problem. 4. Perform routine maintenance on existing electrical systems including cleaning contacts or replacing parts if necessary. 5. Ensure compliance with safety regulations by adhering to established procedures and best practices when working with electricity. 6. Keep records of all work performed including materials used for billing purposes or future reference. Qualifications: 1. High school diploma required; completion of an apprenticeship program is preferred but not mandatory. 2. Valid electrician license/certification issued by relevant authorities is essential (state/provincial/local3. Proven experience working as an electrician is highly desirable; familiarity with residential. Minimum  1 to 2 Years of Experience in Real Estate Company preferred

column2: The Senior Estimation/Proposal Engineer is responsible for analyzing project requirements, preparing detailed cost estimates, and creating comprehensive proposals for potential clients     This role involves collaborating with various departments to gather necessary information, utilizing estimation software and tools, and ensuring that proposals are accurate, competitive, and aligned with the organization's goals     Key Responsibilities:Project Analysis:Review project plans, specifications, and requirements to understand project scope     Conduct site visits, if necessary, to assess project conditions and requirements     Cost Estimation:Prepare accurate and detailed cost estimates for labor, materials, equipment, and overhead     Utilize estimation software and historical data to enhance the accuracy of estimates     Identify and quantify cost factors, such as production time, materials, and labor expenses     Proposal Development:Develop comprehensive proposals outlining project scope, objectives, methodology, and timelines     Prepare detailed technical and commercial proposals that address client needs and specifications     Work closely with technical teams to ensure that the proposed solutions are feasible and meet the client's requirements     Bid Preparation:Prepare and submit bids to clients within specified deadlines     Collaborate with procurement and vendor management teams to gather supplier/subcontractor quotes and integrate them into the proposals     Competitive Analysis:Conduct market research and competitive analysis to determine pricing strategies     Evaluate competitor proposals and pricing to ensure competitiveness and differentiation     Client Interaction:Communicate with clients to understand their needs and address queries related to the proposal     Participate in client meetings and presentations to explain the proposal details and address concerns     Documentation and Reporting:Maintain detailed records of estimates, proposals, and relevant documentation     Generate reports on estimation and proposal activities, highlighting successes, challenges, and areas for improvement     Continuous Improvement:Stay updated with industry trends, best practices, and new technologies related to estimation and proposal engineering     Contribute to process improvements and the development of standardized estimation methodologies within the organization     Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Construction Management, or a related field     Several years of experience in estimation and proposal engineering, preferably in the relevant industry     Proficiency in estimation software and tools     Strong analytical and mathematical skills     Excellent communication and presentation abilities     Project management skills and attention to detail     Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment     Strong negotiation skills and business acumen     A Senior Estimation/Proposal Engineer plays a crucial role in securing new projects and ensuring that the organization's proposals are competitive, accurate, and aligned with client expectations

column2: Job Overview As the Senior Embedded Hardware Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in spearheading the design, development, and deployment of hardware solutions integrating with software and cloud infrastructure. We expect you to be a hands-on engineer and be able to develop an electronics product yourself without needing any external supervision. Should be open to review the designs with industry experts and earn trust of the leadership team. You need to have an engineering first mindset with knowledge across disciplines like power electronics, firmware, embedded systems, certifications as well as mechanical designs. Key Responsibilities Hardware Architecture:  Define and architect complex hardware systems combining power electronics and embedded systems for home automation and security applications. Design and Development:  Hands-on involvement in designing and prototyping hardware solutions, including schematic design, PCB layout, component selection & optimization, and testing.? Power Electronics:  Design and optimise power conversion circuits, including SMPS and motor drives, dimming circuits considering efficiency, thermal management, and EMI/EMC compliance. Embedded Systems Development:  Development of embedded firmware and software, ensuring seamless integration with the hardware platform and real-time performance requirements. Testing and Validation:  Establish rigorous testing methodologies to verify design performance, reliability, and compliance with specifications and standards Technical Leadership & Collaboration:  Build an electronics hardware team from scratch, hire a top quality engineering team and mentor them. Collaborate and work closely with the company founders directly to build an engineering first culture in the team and keep the team motivated with good engineering problems. Engineering Excellence:  Engineering is not just about building products but also ensuring they work flawlessly in the production environment. Engineers should be as close to the customer as possible. This is the culture we would like to build in ATOM8 where engineers will be directly involved with the site issues and sometimes with customers to understand their problems and come up with solutions for customer problems quickly for the short term and also come up with design modification in the products for the long term. Documentation:  Prepare detailed design documentation, specifications, and test reports to ensure clarity and traceability of the development process. Required Skills and Qualifications: Bachelors or Masters degree in Electrical & Electronics Engineering, or related field. Proven experience (5+ years) in hands-on hardware design involving power electronics and embedded systems. Strong proficiency in schematic design tools (Altium, Cadence or others), PCB layout, and simulation tools. Using soldering stations, hot-air guns, and infrared ovens for PCBA PCB layout and schematic generation - digital, analog, and mixed-signal designs Develop an environment of continuous improvement across the product line Project scheduling/estimation Defining project performance requirements Defining specifications, generating documentation, and iterating designs based on feedback from partners Managing day-to-day experimental planning, data analysis, and prioritization of project-based activities Define, design, implement and test software applications using a variety of technologies, including, but not limited to C/C++, Python, Git, and other scripting languages Expertise in power electronics design principles, designing SMPS, analog/digital control techniques and thermal management. Proficiency in embedded systems development (C/C++, RTOS), microcontroller/microprocessor architectures, and communication protocols (SPI, I2C, UART, Ethernet). Experience leading technical teams, driving project execution, and managing design complexity. Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to troubleshoot complex hardware and firmware issues. Strong communication skills with the ability to articulate technical concepts and collaborate effectively across teams. Cross discipline Knowledge and understanding of mechanical housing and casing to be able to make decisions on not just the electronics circuits but also the casings and design for productions. What you need: Prior experience in the design and development of consumer/medical/defense technologies Printed Circuit Board schematic capture, layout, and routing including high-density and high-speed routing Experience working with ARM-based processors (i.e. Cortex-M, Cortex-A) from ST, TI, NXP, Nordic, etc. Volatile and non-volatile external memory (i.e. DDR3, eMMC, NOR/NAND Flash) Micro-controller and peripheral circuit design experience Wifi/BLE/NFC/Cellular modular implementation and debugging experience Experience designing AC/DC SMPS & DC/DC buck/boost converters for low-power devices Troubleshooting embedded systems and debugging tools using DSOs, Bench supplies, and Electrical meters. Writing test cases, generating and documenting test reports Using C or other programming languages for low-level hardware brings up Using ST-CubeIDE, VSCode, C-based firmware development environments Knowledge of firmware debugging, device drivers, and unit testing Familiarity with data structures, algorithms, and design patterns common to embedded (resource-constrained) systems development Adequate knowledge of reading schematics and data sheets for components EMC/EMI shielding mitigation techniques and troubleshooting Design simulation and modelling tools like PSPICE and LTSPICE etc. Signal Processing and Conditioning circuits like Filters, Amplifiers, etc. Excellence in project management, organization and problem solving Ability to interact with electrical, mechanical, and software engineers and work in a fast-paced, multi-disciplinary environment Familiarity with safety and compliance standards (UL, CE, FCC) for hardware designs. Knowledge of FPGAs, DSPs, and wireless technologies (Bluetooth, Wi-Fi, Cellular). Experience with agile development methodologies and tools. Experience in camera related designs is a plus. Why Join Us: If you are a builder you will fit right in. We build all the time, from developing new products from scratch to fixing issues in existing projects to even jugaad solutions to test unorthodox solutions in our lab. Over time you will have the opportunity to build a talented team in developing groundbreaking hardware solutions that have a tangible impact on the home automation and security industry. We offer a competitive compensation package, and the chance to work on challenging projects at the forefront of technology innovation. If you are passionate about hardware design, power electronics, and embedded systems, and enjoy leading high-performing teams, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity!

Collaborate closely with production, maintenance personnel, and suppliers to ensure timely completion of projects related to optical fibre signalling. Familiarity with machining processes relevant to optical fiber signaling components. Understanding of plastic injection molding principles and techniques, especially as applied to optical fiber signaling. Knowledge of injection moulding machines and their operation. Familiarity with mould material selection and surface finishing for optical fiber signaling applications. Ability to work with bio-compatible materials for sterile single-use optical fiber signaling applications. Desired Candidate Profile Requires a minimum of 7 years of experience in electrical engineering related to plastics and composites processing, with a focus on optical fiber signaling, in a manufacturing environment prioritizing quality, innovation, and time-to-market. Collaborate with plant Operation Engineering teams to specify electrical processes and equipment relevant to optical fiber signaling. Provide technical support for the installation of new systems and continuous improvement of existing systems in optical fiber signaling. Engage in the New Product Development process, providing design for manufacture expertise to achieve optimum process capability, consistent quality, and target cost for optical fibre signalling products. Partner with the Advanced Materials and Process Development group to implement leading technological advancements in composites molding processes specifically for optical fibre signalling, aiming for cost competitiveness, higher yields, and near-net shape?manufacturing.

To provide necessary support both operational and safety to the Doctors / Optometrist /Nursing Staff / Operators in terms with equipments usage.
